FuncDef: The reset virtual-cluster-access command restarts a virtual cluster access.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a management IP address for a peer node. The management IP address is usually a loopback interface address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To make configuration changes in a virtual cluster access immediately take effect or manually restore a faulty virtual cluster access, run the reset virtual-cluster-access command to restart the virtual cluster access. If you specify the peer-address parameter, this command restarts the virtual cluster access between the local and peer nodes. If you do not specify the peer-address parameter, this command restarts all virtual cluster accesss associated with the local node.
Precautions
After you run the reset virtual-cluster-access command, the original management channel, VP, and VC are deleted and reestablished.
